hackathon-description-text: HackRPI 2016 is the third intercollegiate hackathon series hosted at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, completely organized and run by RPI students. We will be hosting 500 hackers from the Northeast and beyond for 24 hours.  Students begin working on their hacks on Saturday at 12:30pm and have until Sunday afternoon to complete their hack. All final submissions must be made here, on DevPost, before the end of hacking at 12:30pm on Sunday November 13.
hackathon-eligibility:
You must be in either high school or college. Graduated students (<1 year) will be accepted on a case by case basis.
Teams cannot be larger than 4 people to qualify for HackRPI's prizes. See rules for more details.
hackathon-requirements: There is no theme for HackRPI. Build whatever your imagination desires!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Win a NVIDIA GTX 1060 Graphics Card!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Video Game or Virtual Reality Hack

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Win a AOC 27" Widescreen LED Monitor!
Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment. Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Win HackHarassment Swag Bag.

Everything is part of the internet of things now - from your phone to your fitness band to your thermostat. Build a hack that utilizes private data being collected from your devices, and show how you can turn potential vulnerabilities into something constructive. Prize: Collector's Edition of Watch Dogs 2
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Watch Dogs® 2 Best Device Privacy Hack
Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Win VIP Daily Show tickets! Any project that incorporates media in some creative way is eligible.
Win a weekend trip to Boston!
Win a pair of Urbanears Plattan On-Ear Headphones!

hackathon-description-header: The third annual hackathon at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in Troy, NY
hackathon-location-description: Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, DCC & CII Buildings
